intro: Uvedalia, commonly known as the American sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Uvedalia has lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain the seeds. It is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and stabilizing soil in arid environments.
